FuncDef:
The trust upstream command applies a DiffServ domain.
The undo trust upstream command restores the default settings. The trust upstream command applies a DiffServ domain. The undo trust upstream command restores the default settings. By default, the DiffServ domain default is applied.
ParentView: 100ge sub-interface view,100GE interface view,10GE sub-interface view,10GE interface view,200GE sub-interface view,200GE interface view,25GE sub-interface view,25GE interface view,400GE sub-interface view,400GE interface view,50GE sub-interface view,50GE interface view,Eth-Trunk sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk interface view,Layer 2 sub-interface view,Interface group view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a DiffServ domain.
The value must be the name of an existing DiffServ domain on the device.

Indicates that no DiffServ domain is applied, that is, packet priorities are not trusted.
-

ExtraInfo:
To map priorities of incoming packets to PHBs and colors and map PHBs and colors of outgoing packets to priorities based on the mapping defined in a DiffServ domain, run this command to bind the DiffServ domain. The system performs PHB mapping based on the mapping in the DiffServ domain.
To apply a DiffServ domain to multiple interfaces, you can perform the configuration on the port group to reduce the workload.
